org.orgName: Western District Court of Washington, Northern Division.

body.p: STATE OF WASHINGTON COUNTY OF KING SS.

Samuel H. Weber, being first duly sworn on oath, deposes and says that he is one of the signers of the foregoing bond in the case of the alien J. Ephimoff that he resides at 1509 E. Spruce St. Seattle, Washington, and that the value of his property over and above all debts and liabilities incurred by him and exclusive of property exclusive of property exempt from levy and sale upon execution is over Two Thousand Dollars ($2000.00)---to wit Real Estate in the City of Seattle,, One Hundred and Twenty (120) Feet of Tract 39, of Yesler's Donation Claim to the City of Seattle, and the rpesent fair market value of Deponent's interst is Fifteen Hundred ($1500.00) Dollars and two lots at 119- and 121 6th Street and the present fair value of Deponent's interest is One Thousand ($1000.00) Dolars; and personal property conssiting of a ladies tailoring establishment at 406-Union Street, Seattle.-Fixtures $100.00 Goods, one half interest amounting to $2000.00; that he is now liable upon no other bond, obligation, recognizane, either as principal or surety except as hereinafter stated. Deponent further says, that he is of full age and under no disability to execute the foregoing bond.
Subscribed and sworn to before me this 24 day of February, 1914.
Notary Public in and for the State of Washington residing at Seattle.
STATE OF WASHINGTON COUNTY OF KING. SS

B. Helfand being first duly sworn on oath deposes and says; that he is one of the signers of the Bond in the case of the alien J. Ephimoff that he resides at 1112 Broadway Court in the City of Seattle, and State of Washington and that the value of his property over and above all debts and liabilities incurred by him and exclusive of property exempt from levy and sale upon execution is over One Thousand ($1000.00) Dollars, to wit one ladies tailoring establishment, with fixtures and raw goods, and cahs on hand, that he is now liable upon no other bond, obligation, or recognizance either as principle or surety except as hereinafter provided. Deponent furhter says, that he is of full age and under no legal disability to execute the foregoing bond
Subscribed and sworn to before me this 24 day of February, 1914.
Notary Public in and for the State of Washington residing at Seattle.
